abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is rated
            marginally satisfactory, for although most components were
            implemented, and the privatization of the Compagnie Energie
            Electrique du Togo (CEET) -not foreseen at appraisal -
            represents a major progress, the overall environment, have
            not been conducive to an improved performance, as expected
            at appraisal. While the Bank's performance is rated
            satisfactory, the performance of the borrower showed mixed
            results, for, contrary to its commitments, the borrower
            continued to interfere with the management of CEET. The
            lessons convey, first and foremost, that expected tools,
            namely the performance contract, envisaged during
            preparation to strengthen institutional performance, was not
            a sufficient tool, nor in reducing Government interference.
            However, the agreement reached later with the Government for
            CEET's privatization, which was not an option
            initially, turned the project into a successful operation,
            accepted and supported by the Government and staff at large.
            The economic and political environment, did affect
            CEET's performance, thus, it is suggested that projects
            should be undertaken under sound macroeconomic frameworks,
            to minimize political risks. Furthermore, a comprehensive
            Mid-term Review can help identify problems, and take
            corrective actions towards the achievement of project objectives.
